channel.title: Latest U.S. News | Top headlines from the USA | Reuters
channel.description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest US news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments

image.title: Latest U.S. News | Top headlines from the USA | Reuters

item.title: Laser incidents reported by U.S. pilots hit record in 2021 -- report
item.description: A U.S. government report released Thursday said the number of reported incidents involving aiming of lasers at U.S. airplanes hit a record in 2021 and said regulators should do more to address the problem.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: White House: U.S. to add 1.8 mln doses to monkeypox vaccine supply
item.description: The United States will boost its supply of monkeypox vaccine by making an additional 1.8 million doses of Bavarian Nordic's Jynneos vaccine available for ordering starting Aug. 22, the White House said on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: For leaders abroad, new U.S. law restores climate credibility
item.description: The U.S. climate bill signed into law this week restores the country's credibility as a leading player in U.N. climate negotiations, international officials said.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Salman Rushdie attack suspect to appear in court Thursday
item.description: The man suspected of stabbing novelist Salman Rushdie last week in western New York will appear in court on Thursday afternoon, the prosecutor's office said.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Russia says 'quiet' diplomacy on Griner prisoner swap with U.S. ongoing
item.description: Russia's foreign ministry said on Thursday it was engaged in "quiet diplomacy" with the United States regarding a potential prisoner swap that would include basketball star Brittney Griner.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Literary institution where Salman Rushdie was attacked ramps up security
item.description: Chautauqua Institution, the bucolic New York retreat where Salman Rushdie was attacked last week, has added new security measures, including requiring photo identification and passing through metal detectors prior to entering its venues.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: FBI's sealed evidence that led to search of Trump's home focus of court hearing
item.description: Sealed records containing evidence the U.S. Justice Department presented to secure court approval to search Donald Trump's Florida home will be at the heart of a hearing on Thursday, when news organizations will try to persuade a federal judge that the public deserves to see the details.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Longtime Trump executive Weisselberg to plead guilty in tax fraud scheme
item.description: A longtime senior executive at former President Donald Trump's family business is expected to plead guilty on Thursday to conspiring with the company in a 15-year tax fraud.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Latest U.S. News | Top headlines from the USA
item.description: Reuters.com is your online source for the latest US news stories and current events, ensuring our readers up to date with any breaking news developments
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: In New Mexico, Muslims reject sectarian label for killings
item.description: National Muslim groups have linked the killings of four Muslim men in New Mexico over the past year to sectarianism, but Muslims who knew the victims and suspected gunman point to revenge and personal feuds as possible motives.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: U.S. prosecutors subpoena files given to Capitol attack committee -NYT
item.description: Federal prosecutors examining the role of former President Donald Trump and allies in events ahead of the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the U.S. Capitol have subpoenaed National Archives documents provided to a House of Representatives committee, the New York Times reported.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Giuliani testifies in Georgia criminal probe into 2020 U.S. election
item.description: Rudy Giuliani, Donald Trump's onetime personal lawyer, testified before a special grand jury in Atlanta on Wednesday in a Georgia criminal probe examining attempts by the former U.S. president and his allies to overturn the 2020 election results.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Yellen tells IRS to produce $80 bln spending plan within six months
item.description: U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has directed the head of the Internal Revenue Service to produce a detailed plan for deploying $80 billion in newly enacted enforcement funding within six months, an internal Treasury memo showed on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Rock photographer's gallery draws music lovers to New Jersey beach town
item.description: Danny Clinch has photographed or filmed many of the most famous musicians of modern times - and his decades of work are on display in Asbury Park, the New Jersey beach town made famous by Bruce Springsteen.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Missouri man charged for threatening election official in Arizona
item.description: The U.S. Justice Department said on Wednesday it has charged a Missouri man for leaving threatening voicemails for an election official in Arizona, marking the sixth federal criminal case brought so far to combat the rising tide of threats against local election officials.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Analysis: Rejected by Wyoming Republicans, Cheney sets sights on stopping Trump
item.description: After being soundly rejected by Wyoming Republican voters, U.S. Representative Liz Cheney vowed to spend the next two years trying to stop Donald Trump from returning to the White House - possibly with her own anti-Trump presidential bid.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Liz Cheney accuses Trump of 'insidious lie' about FBI search of his home
item.description: Republican Liz Cheney broadened her attack on Donald Trump after losing her Tuesday night primary, saying the former president was spreading an "insidious lie" in alleging that the FBI agents who searched his Florida home were politically motivated.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: A tree (house) grows in Brooklyn; six-story apartment building has wooden beams
item.description: From the street, 670 Union Street looks like one in a line of brick buildings on a tree-lined block in Brooklyn.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: U.S. reports spike in weapons smuggling to Haiti and the Caribbean
item.description: U.S. authorities have seen a spike in weapons smuggling to Haiti and the Caribbean in recent months, officials said on Wednesday, promising to boost efforts to combat the trade that is fueling rampant gang violence in Haiti and rising crime in the region.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: CDC plans to reorganize structure after pandemic-related criticism -WSJ
item.description: The U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention plans to reorganize its structure to prioritize public health needs and put less emphasis on publication of scientific papers about rare diseases, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Californians asked to cut power use as extreme heat approaches
item.description: Californians were urged to ratchet down the use of electricity in their homes and businesses on Wednesday as a wave of extreme heat settles over much of the state, stretching tight power supplies to their breaking point.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: U.S. retail sales flat in July; core sales rise
item.description: U.S. retail sales were unchanged in July as declining gasoline prices weighed on receipts at service stations, but consumer spending appeared to holding up, which could further assuage fears that the economy was already in recession.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Liz Cheney to battle Trump, may run for U.S. presidency
item.description: U.S. Republican Representative Liz Cheney vowed to do all she could to keep Donald Trump out of the White House and said she would decide in the coming months whether to run for president herself, after she lost to a Trump-backed primary challenger in Wyoming on Tuesday.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Pricey pencils, paper: U.S. teachers get schooled in inflation
item.description: Teachers face a harsh lesson as inflation drives up the cost of everything from paper to pencils before the school year begins, leading some to cut back on supplies - or substitute with cheaper items.
item.dc:creator: Reuters

item.title: Analysis: Biden debt relief plan disappoints Black farmers for avoiding race
item.description: Some Black farmers say they are disappointed by a new U.S. agriculture debt relief program that stands to save thousands of farmers from foreclosure, after the plan failed to specifically target minorities as they had hoped.
item.dc:creator: Reuters
